intro: Xanthostemon longifolius, commonly known as the long-leaved boxwood, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy texture, while its bark is smooth and greyish. Xanthostemon longifolius is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
